result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rogelio A Escalona-Tapia

records.addlTxt: Pretrial 12-13-22 at 2:10 pm and return date 1-6-23 at 10:00 am

2:37 PM Defendant Rogelio A Escalona-Tapia in court. Defendant stated English is easier for him to understand. He had requested a Spanish interpreter for his mother. Court will proceed today in English and in the future we will not have in interpreter present. Court questioned the defendant. The forms he filled out were not filled out with his information. Court will adjourn this hearing. Defendant is to apply with the SPD once he turns 18 and use only his financial information. 2:54 PM
Return date scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:10 pm.
Indigency hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Return date on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:59 AM Defendant Rogelio A Escalona-Tapia in court.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter was scheduled, but was not present. Court reset this hearing. 10:01 AM
Return date scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

For an interpreter for all hearings.  Filed by defendant.

APPROVED AND SCHEDULED.

Pre- trial 9/27/22 at 2:00 PM
Return date 10/14/22 at 9:00 AM
Standard misdemeanor conditions, no contact or be on the premises of  Kwik Trip at 1013 Broadway Ave. Wisconsin Dells, WI

1: PM Defendant Rogelio A Escalona-Tapia appeared by video, in custody at the Columbia County jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Rogelio A Escalona-Tapia.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of complaint, right to attorney recited, $500.00 signature bond, standard misdemeanor conditions,  not possess/consume alcohol, not to be on premises of Kwik Trip at 1013 Broadway in Wisconsin Dells.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Return date scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
